channel.title: Mediagazer
channel.description: Top news and commentary for media professionals from all around the web

item.title: 2017年から2022年にかけてスポティファイで550％の成長を遂げたアフロビーツの成功に、ナイジェリアでの現地スタッフ雇用などスポティファイの現地活動がどのように貢献したか（Damilare Dosunmu/Rest of World）
item.description:
Damilare Dosunmu / Rest of World:
How Spotify's on-the-ground work in Nigeria, like hiring local staff, contributed to the success of Afrobeats, which grew 550% on Spotify between 2017 and 2022  —  The Swedish music giant is pushing to make Africa's biggest sound the world's favorite sound.  —  • LAGOS, NIGERIA

item.title: ベテランのファッションエディター、スタイリスト、その他のニュースレターライターがショッピングのおすすめを紹介する「Substack」でのファッションコンテンツの急増を見てみよう（Chloe Mac Donnell/The Guardian）
item.description:
Chloe Mac Donnell / The Guardian:
A look at the surge of fashion content on Substack, as veteran fashion editors, stylists, and other newsletter writers give shopping recommendations  —  We used to look to magazines, store assistants and bloggers to help us decide what to buy.  Now the publishing site has become the go-to spot for style advice

item.title: ボット・ファームや海賊がミュージシャンの作品のラベルを貼り替えて収益を盗むなど、音楽ストリーミング詐欺の実態に迫る。Beatdappは、詐欺によるミュージシャンの損害を年間20億ドルと見積もっている（David Segal/New York Times）。
item.description:
David Segal / New York Times:
A look at music streaming fraud, including bot farms and pirates relabeling musicians' work to steal revenue; Beatdapp estimates fraud costs musicians $2B/year  —  Bad Dog, a group from D.C., was forced to take a crash course in streaming fraud, a shadowy realm that costs musicians $2 billion a year.

item.title: 第75回エミー賞では、WBDのHBOとMaxが31部門を受賞、Netflixが22部門、FXが16部門、Apple TV+が10部門、Disney+が9部門、Amazon Prime Videoが6部門、NBCが5部門を受賞した（Lesley Goldberg/The Hollywood Reporter）。
item.description:
Lesley Goldberg / The Hollywood Reporter:
WBD's HBO and Max won 31 awards at the 75th Emmy Awards, while Netflix won 22, FX 16, Apple TV+ 10, Disney+ nine, Amazon Prime Video six, and NBC five  —  This year, the conglomerate did not designate if a show was made for HBO proper or its streamer, Max, instead grouping its nominations under …

item.title: ナインは、12月に辞任したジェームス・チェッセルの後任として、SMHとエイジの現エグゼクティブ・エディターであるトリー・マグワイアを出版担当マネージング・ディレクターに指名した（Calum Jaspan/Sydney Morning Herald）。
item.description:
Calum Jaspan / Sydney Morning Herald:
Nine names Tory Maguire, the current executive editor of SMH and The Age, as its Managing Director of Publishing, after James Chessell resigned in December  —  Tory Maguire has been appointed managing director of Nine's publishing division, which houses mastheads The Sydney Morning Herald, The Age and The Australian Financial Review.

item.title: 10月7日以来、イスラエル国防軍の護衛なしでガザに入った初の欧米人記者クラリッサ・ウォードは、イスラエル寄りの主張に直面しながらも、いかにしてアラブの苦しみを浮き彫りにしたか（Clare Malone/New Yorker）
item.description:
Clare Malone / New Yorker:
How Clarissa Ward, the first Western reporter to enter Gaza without an IDF escort since October 7, highlights Arab suffering as she faces pro-Israel bias claims  —  Clarissa Ward, the first Western reporter to enter Gaza without an I.D.F. escort since October 7th, has faced accusations …

item.title: シンクレアのデビッド・スミス執行会長は、2021年5月にボルチモア・サン・メディアを買収したオールデンからボルチモア・サン・メディアを買収。
item.description:
Lorraine Mirabella / Baltimore Sun:
David Smith, executive chairman of Sinclair, acquires Baltimore Sun Media from Alden, which bought the outlet in May 2021; Sinclair wasn't involved in the deal  —  The Baltimore Sun, the largest newspaper in Maryland, has been acquired in a private deal by David D. Smith …

item.title: OpenAIが2024年の選挙に向けた計画を発表、画像証明ツールや、なりすましや政治的キャンペーンのためのツールをユーザーに作らせないことなどが含まれる（OpenAI）
item.description:
OpenAI:
OpenAI shares its plans ahead of 2024 elections, including image provenance tools and not letting users make tools for impersonation or political campaigning  —  We're working to prevent abuse, provide transparency on AI-generated content, and improve access to accurate voting information.  —  Authors

item.title: アフリカ50カ国で展開するショーマックスがリニューアル、アンドレア・ザッピアを会長に任命、コムキャストと提携、5年で10億ドルの収益を目指す（Loni Prinsloo/Bloomberg）
item.description:
Loni Prinsloo / Bloomberg:
Showmax, available in 50 African countries, relaunches, appoints Andrea Zappia as chair, and partners with Comcast, aiming to generate $1B revenue in five years  —  - Showmax re-launched its service on Monday to grow audiences  — Service is targeting $1 billion in revenues in five years

item.title: 型破りで異例のアイオワ州共和党予備選の取材、2016年との違い、メディア不信などについて、キャスターやネットワーク特派員が語る（Ted Johnson/Deadline）
item.description:
Ted Johnson / Deadline:
Anchors and network correspondents talk about covering the unconventional and an unusual Iowa GOP primary, the differences from 2016, media mistrust, and more  —  The Iowa caucus on Monday will be like no other —  and that was apparent from the start, well before subzero weather raised doubts …

item.title: ストリーミングのおかげで音楽業界は9年間成長してきたにもかかわらず、スポティファイやUMGのような企業は給与を引き締めたり、従業員を解雇したりしている（Lucas Shaw/Bloomberg）
item.description:
Lucas Shaw / Bloomberg:
Despite nine years of music industry growth thanks to streaming, companies like Spotify and UMG are tightening payouts or laying off employees  —  After years of a streaming boom, record labels are searching for their next big win.  —  Last year was brutal for the media business …

item.title: アイリッシュ・サン紙、キーラン・マクデイドの後任としてフィオナ・ウィン副編集長を編集長に任命、これでサン紙の全国3版すべてが女性編集長となる（Bron Maher/Press Gazette）
item.description:
Bron Maher / Press Gazette:
The Irish Sun appoints Deputy Editor Fiona Wynne as editor, replacing Kieran McDaid, meaning all three national editions of The Sun are now led by women  —  The appointment means each national edition of The Sun is edited by a woman.  —  Irish Sun deputy editor Fiona Wynne will replace Kieran McDaid …

item.title: 大量出版戦略への依存など、メッセンジャー紙がスタッフを解雇し、経営難に陥っている問題（Laura Wagner/Washington Post）
item.description:
Laura Wagner / Washington Post:
A look at issues at The Messenger, including its reliance on a high-volume publishing strategy, as the outlet lays off staff and struggles to stay afloat  —  Jimmy Finkelstein had big dreams and a $50 million investment.  Eight months after the Messenger's launch, it is laying off staff and struggling to stay afloat.

item.title: Mirror』誌のアリソン・フィリップス編集長は4年近く務めた後、1月末で退任する予定で、後任には『Reach Magazines』誌のキャロライン・ウォーターストンEICが就任する（Charlotte Tobitt/Press Gazette）。
item.description:
Charlotte Tobitt / Press Gazette:
Mirror Editor-in-Chief Alison Phillips plans to step down at the end of January after almost four years, succeeded by Reach Magazines EIC Caroline Waterston  —  Mirror editor-in-chief Alison Phillips will step down at the end of January after almost six years leading the brand.

item.title: 2017年にスタートし、幅広いテーマを扱い、リスナーが全額出資する週刊Blindboy Podcastのホスト兼クリエイターであるBlindboyのプロフィール（Daniel Dylan Wray/The Guardian）
item.description:
Daniel Dylan Wray / The Guardian:
A profile of Blindboy, host and creator of the weekly Blindboy Podcast, which launched in 2017, covers a wide-range of subjects, and is fully listener-funded  —  He wears plastic bags as an ‘autistic protest’ and makes podcasts about everything from fish fingers to the Baileys sex cult.
